author: Rebecca G.

description:
I had the wrong impression from this place through word of mouth and from the looks of it from the outside. I thought it was going to be some crazy leather bar with Wild Ones all over the place. It was a lot cooler than that!

The bartender was super friendly, the drinks were cheap, the pool table was fun, and the crowd was chill. 

If you don't dig the club scene in the Castro, or you enjoy the Pilsner Inn, you'll love this place.
author: Sam S.

description:
Of course I love the Eagle -- I'm there three or four evenings a week -- but allow me to correct the misconception that it's a "biker bar":

The Eagle is not a biker bar.

Of course it's chock-full of motorcycle accoutrements including at least two actual motorcycles, and you can park your bike on the sidewalk, and it offers 50 cents off drinks to anyone walking in with a helmet, so it does attract the occasional motorcyclist (myself included), but except for the first Friday evening of every month -- when the local gay sportbike riders club shows up en masse -- it's usually fairly bereft of bikers. 

So, if you're nervous about being surrounded by big scary bikers, don't be. The motorcyclists who hang out there tend to be of the (dare I say it?) more twinkish and/or punkish variety. And another warning: if you're at all crowd-phobic, do like I do and avoid the Sunday beer bust, esp. on warm sunny days. That's when my biker buddies and I tend to hang out at the Hole instead.
author: Peter H.

description: I love the Eagle! The staff are all HOT and friendly, The patrons are usually all HOT and sorta friendly. The patio is the best- I almost never hang out inside unless it is too packed or stormy outside. HOT men, cold beer, a fine patio, and no attitude. Who could ask for more?
author: Nick B.

description:
Imagine a biker bar in Bozeman, Montana but without the women... dimly lit, neon beer displays, burly mustaccioed men, soiled underwear hanging from the ceilings...oh, OK so maybe it's a little different. The typical demographic here is aging hippie biker bear, but outsiders will certainly not be stared at or frowned upon (groped, maybe). There is a rectangular bar island in the middle of the first room and a stage in the back. The restrooms, interestingly, can only be accessed via the stage, so good luck during a live performance. Also, the main restroom is just a trough (equipped with a mirror at penis height) and a standalone toilet. The other, more "private" bathroom is a toilet behind a swinging door. A third bathroom is simply another exposed trough out back. The second room is a dark, second bar, manned by a lone, sketchy bartender. The coolest space is outside, where there is yet a third bar. This space is more like a large private backyard, with big fences and foliage on the periphery. 

The target audience (you know who you are) will feel right at home. Others, you're in for a trip.
author: Alexander M.

description:
I'm a fan of the Sunday beer bust on a clear SF day.  

I'm not a fan of some of the smells.
author: Marcus C.

description:
My neighborhood bar - oh what fun times to be had at the Sunday Beer Bust.  The usual suspects are expected.  Sometimes, just like any place, it is hit-or-miss with the guys.   Contact highs are to be had, as pot smokers run the gamut here... and did I pee on someone in the bathroom?  Oh, too many beers.  It just had to happen, and it was actually fun.  Do I detect a fetish breaking out??  Well, maybe not all that much, but when you let loose... you let it loose.  Oh yeah.

Leather never hurts, but I feel Saturday night is moving more in that direction.  Bust out the Chaps!!
author: Benjamin B.

description:
I LOVE THE EAGLE!!!  great bar, fun bartenders (matty & vern rock!), rockin outdoor patio with fireplace.  Shoe-shining station and good wholesome naughty fun. 
They can be rude to 'vanilla-yuppie-peeps' so beware - but it only helps keep the vibe of what makes the Eagle fabulous!!! Lots of hot leather daddies and the dirty grrls who love them!
thanks for all the fun boys!!
author: mr. PAM X.

description:
My sister is a rock star.

No, I don't mean that in the trite way people toss about the term "rock star" these days.  I mean literally.  She has rocked with many in the past, and now she plays drums with the all girl AC/DC tribute band, AC/Dshe.  My sister is a for real no joke kick your ass rock star.

Anyway, after going to see her rock out Saturday night, my friend Su and I headed into the Eagle to sit by the backyard fire.  

I've been to the Eagle on a few occasions in the past, either to see some friend or relative rock or to sit by this fire pit contemplating rocks or stars or the like.

This time we didn't even order drinks which probably didn't sit too well with the Eagle, but then it was nearing the 2 a.m. bewitching hour and we just wanted to warm ourselvs by the fire and do girl talk and relationship advice.

I'm really glad a place like the Eagle exists, that hosts small live bands, has a backyard complete with fire pit and is home to a bunch of bears.  There are fewer places a girl can feel comfortable than in a true bear's lair where for once, the long-haired female type is not considered the tasty morsel.  I love bears.
author: michelle g.

description:
YEAH!!

The bartender Verne introduced himself to us, gave us a tour including bathroom and back patio where you can smoke!! It wasn't too crowded which really tickles my 'pickle'.

Plus the music was cool and the neon lights. The only thing that sucked was my friend got sick and we had to leave. I guess that means the drinks are nice and strong ey!!?
author: Danielle G.

description:
I always have a blast every time I go to The Eagle. Good stiff drinks, a trivia machine, KICKIN' tunes from the DJ booth, and the Punk Rock Thursdays are as much fun to attend as they are to play!

The scenery is usually pretty nice too, and by scenery I mean bears.
author: Johnny E.

description: My Gay boys took me to this gay bar, no boys for me boo. Well the boys liked me there but uh I need them to turn straight. I like their outdoor area, not to thrilled about the inside, too dark with creepy older men. Had a blueberry vodka tonic, it was yummy. Next bar please...
author: Karen T.

description:
Hilarious clientele wearing leather, doing their makeup in front of the vintage candy machine ...a couple of toy terriers were running around humping each other. Everyone was smiling. great patio for a warm, muggy afternoon. 

i liked this place.

minus one star only...the seating (benches only pretty much) was not great. Thats ok, after a few drinks you dont really care

Fun music, reasonably-priced drinks, great for outdoor nights. By the time the band comes on at 9 you're too tipsy to remember them. :)
author: Tara S.

description: A leather bar, mostly. But what makes the Eagle great is that it became a great, not-necessarily gay, live music venue when the dot-com boom fucked all that up.  Oh, and the patio is really big and sheltered and they sometimes have really good BBQ.  OH, OH and the handjobs aren't bad either.
author: patrick g.

description: Next time you're dragged to the DNA Lounge for Goth Night Barbecue or whatever the fuck it's called, this is where to run to.  I went on a Friday and it was completely empty.  Apparently, this is the best place in town to play a show.  Now I can see why.  Great bartenders who were fucking with me because I was alone but in a very funny way, decent prices, non-locking shitter.  Maybe I'm so charmed because I'm using DNA as a foil, but shit Hoss, I think I've found my new bar.
author: J P.

description:
Have I ever told you how much I love freaky people?  Well, the Eagle brings out the drunkest and the most awesomest freaks for the Sunday Beer Bust.  The people watching here is second only to the Folsom Street Fair, but at the Eagle the fun crowd shows up weekly for the $10 all you can drink beer bust.

Not only do super rad, super drunk crazies show up in swarms, but the tamale lady also makes an appearance on Sunday afternoons.  Getting drunk for $10 is pretty exciting, but getting drunk for $10 plus eating the best most homemadest tamales ever is totally fucking awesome.
author: t l.

description: The Eagle is a gem! Great jukebox and a patio that rivals Zeitgeist, complete with fun hiding places and cozy fire pit. It was tough for a straight gal like me to get a drink. But, based on my hangover, I still did alright.
author: Esme W.

description: I give this place 5 stars based on shock value.  i thought I understood the meaning of the word "bear" but i was wrong.  The drinks are cheap, and the sunday beer bust is a lot of fun on a hot day as long as you're buzzed before it gets totally crowded.
author: Caleb D.

description: If you are a person missing a bladder or one who never has to pee, you will enjoy this bar (read all the other review for an explaination). But if you're like me and drinking beer makes you pee, avoid this bar at all costs, because the bathroom is something out of a nightmare. All I could think about while using the facilites was that somehow Freddy Krueger was going to bust down the door and yell at me for peeing in his bedroom.
author: Stumbalina b.

description: It's a great place to hang out on sundays specially for the beer bust but there's a little problem: the cheap beer they sell always gives me Diahreaa and I am not the only one who says this?.. Some of my friends experienced the same. not a biggy but funny...If you are visitor and want to see  a different crowd this is the place...
author: Juan P.

description: Great bar with a super awesome staff...ahem. Even though one of them was voted 'most crankiest' they're still pretty stellar. The music is great when Doug is djing for sure, and on Thursdays when there are live bands. Stiff drinks and one of the best patios in all The City.
author: Colleen B.

description: Perhaps one of the fondest memories I have of SF in my 3 years of habitating in this fair city is taking my midwestern straight cornfed parents to the Eagle on a Saturday afternoon. They still get a kick out of telling their waspy friends about watching a guy wearning nothing but leather chaps smoke a joint. "Our favorite place was the gay leather bar!" brings nothing but amused giggles from stifled middle class christians. I love this place, try to go as much as I can, and believe that for me, it truely is one-of-a-kind, San Francisco at its best.
author: Libby T.

description: Sunday beer bust is OK but don't come here during the week. Weirdest crowd in SF.
author: Michael R.

description: The Eagle Rocks.  I'm straight, but I love coming here for a show on Thursdays when the bear scene invites the indie-music scene to cross-pollenate.  It's also nice getting my ego boosted by hairy leathery dudes, and I absolutely love it when I go to take a pee and there's a guy jerking off in plain view in the urinal next to me.  Seriously, now, "That's Entertainment!"
author: Ben V.

description: I liked it better BEFORE it was the Eagle Tavern and it was just the plain old San Francisco Eagle, new ownership has changed it.  It's lost it's leather, Levi's, uniform, fetish appeal.  The music is still great and the Sunday beer bust is still a fund-raising event, but it feels "pussified" now. Sad. Just look at some of the other reviews that poke fun at the patrons with fetishes who've been going to the Eagle for years.  The hispsters need to get a grip and go where they will be participants and not gawkers.
author: Adam Z.

description: I think I was the only one that was carded here during this past Sunday's beer bust. That's okay. The line for the 'girl's' bathroom was never long.
author: Micaela G.

description:
I love the Eagle! I moved to San Francisco about 6 months ago and upon my first week here I got to visit the Eagle on Sunday for the beer bust and I loved it! I am from Chicago where our gay bars are pretty damn awesome so I think I have high standards but my standards have now been raised to a much higher level. I am a black lesbian and very much worried I wouldn't fit into this establishment but I was welcomed with open arms. The biggest adjustment has been learning to pace my drinks because if you dare pound your drinks at the Eagle you will NOT last very long. The bartenders aren't the friendliest but that's the only real way it should be at a biker bar. Ladies if you are big on not waiting in a huge line for the bathroom this isn't the place for you but after a two or three drinks you will just about piss anywhere at this place. 
I loved how diverse the crowd was ;A&F dudes, muscle guys, nasty pigs, leathers dudes and much much more. Definitely check out the eagle on a Sunday for the beer bust. Keep an eye on the weather because if its too cold the crowd will not reach its full potential.
author: Shelly D.

description: G-d bless/damn the Eagle. I've enjoyed/wasted more of my life here than any other bar. And, yes, the handjobs are terrific/scary.
author: Billy A.

description: Nope, I'm not gay but this place is pretty damn cool. Went there to see a friend's band play - Hot Fog. Pretty cool character (motor parts and boxers) and sweet outside area. Good vibe on the night I was there and it wasn't too much of a sausage fest either. Good drinks.
author: Lucas B.

description:
friends and i like to reference this bar in the city right before we start cappin on each others mom's..

a typical exchange would go like this...

Me: "hey, saw you heading into the eagle the other day..."

Them: "yeah, that wasnt me, but Rob Halford just called and said he left his chaps at your house last night..."

Me: "that little bi**h!"

and so forth... 

and i have never actually been in no matter what damon tells you...
author: Danny D.

description: I love the Eagle, especially Sunday Beer Busts.  $10 gets you all the beer you can drink and food to boot.  You can see all kinds of interesting things and people there - from twinky castro boys to hardcore leather men.   The first Friday night of the month is hot too - the gay sportbikers group goes there for drinkies.
author: Jay L.

description: Wow.  The Eagle.  Been living in the city over 5 years and never had a desire to go.   My mistake! What a great layout.  Unexpected were all the gay folks from different walks of life and backgrounds.  I didn't get to experience things that my friend mentioned, but I can do without a guy on stage eating out a girl- funny thing, I bet he was gay.
author: Andre S.

description: The Eagle is a great great leather bar for leather folks, and everyone in between leather to vanilla.  Granted, some of my friends are into the leather scene,  so I do go here more than I normally would.  Its got an even greater patio than Zeitgeist, the drinks are always reasonably priced, and reasonably filled with alcohol, and  the music isn't always the greatest or most cool but I always have fun when Im hanging out on the patio, under the great heaters
author: Janet R.

description: We came here quite inebriated already but I'm pretty sure that wasn't the only reason I liked this place! Great space inside and awesome space outside. Good affordable drinks. Kind people.  Good crowd.  I'll be back!
author: Aaron W.

description:
gotta admit: i was intimidated because neither am i gay nor am i a big bear biker. still, a really cool band was playing for their Thursday Nite Live (regulars Thee Oh Sees, they're amazing, check them out), so i had no choice.

so i went, and by myself too.

the second i walked in, i loved it. it just had a good feel. (also, there were pretty girls everywhere, which might have helped). it's a very cool place, they get great live music, the drinks are cheap, love it.

check it out.
author: Ronny K.

description: It's fun, it's fascinating, it's nasty and everyone is made to feel welcome even a little straight girl like me.  The staff is friendly, the drinks are stiff.  Live music.  "It's a rainbow of fruit flavors.."
author: Vivienne B.

description: I've had a lot of sex here.  Which is awesome, because I'm a girl on the outside, and a big sexy gay bear on the inside.  Oh yeah, and the beer is good, the patio is good, etc. etc.
author: Polly Enmity P.

description: 5 stars for the Sunday Beerbust.  Always a pleaser.  I'm confused with the bartenders though.  They sort of stand out as a weird bunch.  Motor cycle "Straight" crowd kind of aura.  I would prefer a bartender in a gay bar that is gay. They have the best Weiners for those that partake of the $10 Beerbust. It's like a 10" weiner.  Maybe there is a coorelation.
author: Roger S.

description: went by yesterday, sad to see a "closed" sign stapled to the locked door.
author: Dann D.

description: Based on the fact that i had only two drinks there last night, which made me feel like MC Hammer and Whitney Houston were salsa dancing in my head -- I give my two thumbs up! This bar simply doesn't mess around when it comes to satisfying their alcoholic patrons. The crowd is diverse -- hell's angels look alikes mingling w/ howdy doody and peewee herman wannabes spitting game at a FTM. This I like b/c noone gave a shit about anyone else's business and were all drunk anyway. Hosts good live music and the backyard rivals ones like the End Up and El Rio but with cool sculptures, a well/fountain/thingamajig, and fire pits.
author: Angel S.

description: I smoked a fat stogy with my pals out on the patio one warm afternoon.  There was a leather thing going on but we were there to see Therese Taylor specifically.  There were some killer munchies and I drank a lot of beer.  The leather show was not really my thing but it added to the whole atmosphere of the place.
author: Tracy A.

description:
the only reason i dock the eagle one star is because there were hardly any people there on a saturday night. i know that's not the eagle's fault, but it made me a little sad, and i can't give five stars to a bar that made me a little sad. 

when my online date suggested we meet at a "gay biker bar," naturally i jumped at the chance. it was the best call he made all night. they have a pool table, pinball machines a couple video games if i remember right, and best of all, a firepit on the open air patio outside. think el rio or zietgeist with room to breathe, beefy biceps and beards. 

this bar should have been packed. i'll be back.
author: jean w.

description: I am non-gay,but I can get down with what this gay bar is pushing most definitely. Last night I had only 2 vodka and tonics and was pushed to the brink of insanity due to the alcoholic content. Either Ive become an extremely cheap date, or the bartender likes to make those things STIFF. If you are a woman...and can look over the fact the womens room has no door this is a very straight friendly environment. A great backyard with a fire pit.The tamale lady from the Zeitgiest comes here too so when you are seeing double you have something to nosh on. did i just say nosh? Im turning into my mother
author: Lauren V.

description: I wasn't too impressed with the Eagle.  When I went they didn't have anything on tap except high life, the indie band (yea i know that's weird for the eagle) was kind of wack.  I think it's supposed to be funner on beer bus day.
author: Matt N.

description: Huge backyard with a fire pit. Its usually a very mixed crowd, or Ive just become accostomed to San Francisco idea of a mixed crowd. The bartenders are fast! Even when its crowded, drinks are quick, and my cocktail orders dont make them pout. I love it here until I have to pee..... see other reviews. Its like Candy Man
author: Melissa B.

description: I love this place!  The bartenders are all friendly and they don't look like your typical "A-gay" list bartenders.  They look and act like real, normal people and aren't on the make with you like bartenders elsewhere.  The music is -- well, awesome.  No disco or "dance music" here!  I like the mix of gay and others (straight, bi, whatever) who come in because of the tradition of rock on Thursdays.  It makes for a nice mix.  I just wish the drink prices were a *little* cheaper.
author: Halhry C.

description: i like bars where you can basically do whatever you feel like and no one gets on you for it, whether it's doing nothing or something.  Gay bars seem to be good at this.  I was here too early on a Saturday night to give a full-kind-of-general review (10pm), but it is what it is and that was just me, my pal, a little bonfire over a big grill, left over food from some firefighters holiday party that afternoon, a guy heating up some left over chili and mac-n-cheese on top the outside patio heaters that he had to climb a picnic table to get to, a few odd guys looking frozen like stiffs in the back, totally unmoving for what seemed like hours, and that's about it.  Still entertaining though for a starting spot, despite how lame all that may sound.
author: Today Y.

description: For me, it's ONLY a good spot for Beer Bust even if it IS cheap beer!! Hey, $10 for all you can drink from 3p-6p???? I'm IN like Flynn!!! I've gone a few other times and NOT on a Sun and all I gotta say about that is that I'll only ever go on a Sun afternoon ever again!!!
author: Rob L.

description: I was visiting from the ATL where we have our own Eagle.  I spent my Memorial Day here since I didn't know anyone else in the city.  Nice bunch of guys.  The managing bartender made me a fucking spicy bloody mary on the house and they were having a barbecue out back.  In the ATL, The Eagle is a dance club-cum-leather/levi bar.  So it's all fat bears and their admirers doing the cha-cha to Madonna mixes.  When I went to The Eagle Tavern, they were rocking out.   Unfortunately the coat-check tweaker guy with the worst breath ever really wanted to get in my pants, too.  I will still make it a point to do their Sunday beer bust next time I'm here.
author: Flip C.

description: The Eagle has a great bar and one of the best layout/spaces in the city.  It's never crowded except when there's a live band or on Sunday beer bust.  (I wasn't there either of those times, but that's what those in the know say.)  If you're a bear or into leather, you've no doubt been here, and if you're not, you should still go check it out.
author: Andy G.

description: The patio is great, heated outdoor spaces, open fire. Indoors, there is plenty of space as well. Seems nice enough. But the biker crowd is not my crowd, kinda creeps me out a little. I missed the popular Sunday party, so this review is I guess incomplete.
author: Teddy D.

description: I friggin' love this bar! This is the best place to wet your whistle in SF. Cheap, strong, huge drinks. The staff are super friendly and so are the customers. The live music is enjoyable but my favorite part is the outdoor patio area, it's huge and tastefully decorated. My only complaint is that it is a cash only bar, but hey, you can't have everything. The bathrooms also lack doors but when you're sloshed it doesn't matter. I come here whenever i am in the area. If you have not experienced The Eagle Tavern you are sorely missing something important in your life.
author: Doctor Z.

description: If ever there were a frigate ship, full of the raunchiest pirates...this place would be just that. It is truly a debauched experience. Oh, the sights I have seen in this place and under the very eye's of God. They shiver me timbers...did I happen to mention that I to relish "Timber". Regardless, if you relish "Timber" or prefer your treasure in a "Chest". I highly recommend these high seas. The Eagle plays the best music, has the best patio and the features the most eclectic array of scoundrels this side of Mos Eisley Space Port. I love to end or start my week with this den of depravity. One time I witnessed a Dolphin-Short's wearing Santa Claus, tongue-kissing a Sid Vicious looking youth, whilst listening to that X song "Nausea'. I'm not kidding, you can't make that shit up. Check this joint out...I dare you.
author: Gabe T.

description: One of the funnest bars I've had the pleasure to go to. Brian the bartender is AWESOME!!!! and one of the sweetest people I've EVER met....and you do meet a lot of them here specifically on Sundays. I wish they had more of the mud wrestling other than once a year.....but I'm sure it's hard to clean.... All in all a great place with an eclectic group of people.
author: Troy H.

description: If you're lookin for a trashy and cheap beer bust w/some fairly attractive gay men; then Sunday's your day!  They have an outdoor area, which is fun, but it gets crowded there fast, so get there on time.
author: Tom D.

description: The patio, the patio, the patio!  Need I say more.  This is a stoner's heaven.  Additionally, I love the live music on Thursday nights, although I sometimes go home with my ears ringing.  Bear (I mean beer) Bust on Sundays is always a specticle.  If you want to see a lot of bear chested men, I suggest going.  And the drinks...as mentioned before are S-T-I-F-F- just like other body parts you may or may not see on any given night.
author: Jason W.

description: this is probably my favorite bar in the city, if only for the amazing patio.  it has a fire pit.  unfortunately, i am neither gay nor a biker so i have only been twice; once to meet friends and another time for a show.  but i will find any excuse to hang here.
author: Markus B.

description: after the chocolate festival 2 of my friends were going to the beer bust at the eagle. my other 2 friends and i had never been so we decided to try something new. its $10 and you get all you can drink beer.  the 3 of us dont drink beer so we got to go in free. :)  its bigger than i expected... inside and out... the outside patio has a stage and sf swing, which is a kind of boston pops orchestra band, was playing. inside was rock, maybe classic rockish? not my type of place, not my type of crowd... we 3 newbies decided it was good to have seen, but that hr was very long and kinda boring cuz we were out of our element (esp me, being a girl). so great for leather guys or even leather girls, or if you want to drink lots of beer.
author: Merredith L.

description: always feels like coming home. a true sf treasure.
author: Evil E.

description: sad sign of the times another great SOMA 'grand-poo-ba' gay levi-leather watering hole and w/patio bites the dust cuz of more real estate greed, why? really stupid and so where do all the butch queens old+young go now cuz the Castro just doesn't cut it?
author: Ron M.

description: i went here a few weeks ago to listen to a friend's band. the drinks were strong, the crowd was eclectic and the heated patio was amazing, considering the record low temps of late. if you hit up the bathroom inside by the stage, be sure to take someone with you to guard the entrance since there isn't a door. or don't, if you're into that sorta thing.
author: Megan S.

description: This bar is always fun. The bathroom situation does stress me out a bit, especially after I dropped my panties in the men's bathroom on the stage and someone walked in on me (thankfully, I knew the guy, but still, a bit awkward.) There's a port-a-pot in the back garden area, and maybe a set of troughs for the boys in the back, but I always walk on stage and usually wait in line for the ladies room (the one with the door). On a side note, why do women take so long to pee? I pee frequently, but at least I pee quickly. The bands that play are usually good (I think I usually go on Thursdays?) - unless you go on an off night and you're not drinking - then this place can be pretty shitty. I don't know what it is about the Eagle, but I really cannot just order a beer. It has to come with a shot of whiskey, and then the trouble begins. Something about this place just calls out to the inner alcoholic in you and you just want to rage all night.
author: Brittany L.

description: I only go here on Sunday afternoons for the beer bust (even though I don't drink beer) and have a great time. It's usually packed with a great variety of guys - something for everyone. Claim a spot or you'll spend your time there fighting your way through the crowds. They also have pool if you're up for that, but who wants to be inside?
author: Michael G.
